title: chinese_pedestal_table
body:
A traditional Chinese elevated table or stand (花几/Huājǐ), also known as 花架 (Flower Rack) or 花台 (Flower Platform), Characterized by slender legs and ornate carvings, it serves both functional and symbolic purposes in classical interiors, often reflecting Confucian aesthetics of balance and harmony.

Frequently appears in scenes depicting traditional Chinese interior, imperial palace, or scholars study. Often paired with calligraphy scroll and incense burner to create a refined atmosphere.

Primarily used to elevate prized objects (e.g., blue and white porcelain, bonsai) for visual prominence in halls or studies.

body:
[b]Iago[/b] (マクベス, [i]Macbeth[/i] in the Japanese version) is a character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Nohr's tactician, Macbeth serves as a retainer and henchman to [[Garon_(fire_emblem)|]].

title: garon_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Garon[/b] (ガロン) is a character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The King of Nohr. The father who raised [[Corrin (fire emblem)|]]. With natural suspicion of others and lust for power, he is an ambitious person who intends to invade the Kingdom of Hoshido.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Dark Lord

h4. Appearance

* !post #3254443

title: fuga_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Fuga[/b] (フウガ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The chieftain of Hoshido’s Wind Tribe, he's the late King Sumeragi's best friend. He possesses a majesty unique to a veteran hero and his entire body exudes the presence of a stalwart warrior. He is [[Hayato_(fire_emblem)|]]'s adoptive father. He is the most loved by children.

He is voiced by Hiroshi Matsumoto in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Weapon Master

h4. Appearance

title: shiro_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Shiro[/b] (シノノメ, [i]Shinonome[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Shiro is the son of [[Ryoma (fire_emblem)|]] and the cousin of [[Kiragi (fire_emblem)|]]. Even though he is a little emotional with deep feelings of hatred, he is friendly and easy to get along with. He is the strongest arm wrestler out of everyone in the army.

He is voiced by Takumi Yasuaki in the Japanese version and by Kaiji Tang in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Spear Fighter.

Selkie is the daughter of [[Kaden_(fire_emblem)|]]. She has an innocent and cheerful personality, one that has never seen danger. She is the least afraid of things in the army.

title: mitama_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Mitama[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Mitama is the daughter of [[azama_(fire_emblem)|Azama]]. She is normally very polite but is known to have a sharp tongue like her father. Still, she thinks that her father is a nag. She loves sleeping as much as she can and spends the most amount of time dreaming, more so than anyone else in the army.

She speaks almost entirely in haiku and has [[star-shaped pupils]].

She is voiced by Azusa Satou in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Priestess

h4. Appearance

* !post #8428522

title: kiragi_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Kisaragi[/b] (キサラギ, [b]Kiragi[/b] in the English version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates|Fire Emblem if]] (Fire Emblem Fates). He is voiced by Kiyotaka Furushima in the Japanese version and by Yuri Lowenthal in the English localization.

Kisaragi is the son of [[takumi_(fire_emblem)|Takumi]] and the cousin of [[shiro_(fire_emblem)|Shinonome]]. Both optimistic and friendly, Kisaragi thinks of everything in a positive way. He has the best eyesight out of everyone in the army.

body:
[b]Caeldori[/b] (マトイ, Matoi) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. 

She is the daughter of [[Subaki (fire_emblem)|Subaki]]. Inspired by her father's perfection, Caeldori devoted herself to train and eventually become perfect like him.

Caeldori was based on the character [[Cordelia (Fire Emblem)|Cordelia]] from [[Fire Emblem Awakening]], sharing several similarities with her like appearance, voice and personality.

She is voiced by Eimi Okada in the Japanese version and Julie Ann Taylor in the English version.

title: gravel
body:
Gravel is crushed [[rock|stone]], used as a bed for [[railroad tracks]] and as a durable [[garden]] mulch. Very fine gravel may be used to line the bottoms of [[fishbowl|fish bowls]] and [[fish tank|fish tanks]].

Use this tag for bulk gravel. Individual stones should be tagged [[rock]] or [[pebble]].

title: omikuji
body:
Random fortunes written on strips of paper at [[Shinto]] [[shrine]]s in Japan. Tying these strips of paper to trees or wires is a common custom, especially when receiving a negative fortune.

The short messages that may be found on them follow below, ordered tentatively from worst to best:

* 大凶 (dai-kyou), Great Curse
* 末凶 (sue-kyou), Future Curse
* 半凶 (han-kyou), Half-Curse
* 小凶 (shou-kyou), Small Curse
* 凶 (kyou), Curse
* 末小吉 (sue-shou-kichi), Future small Blessing
* 末吉 (sue-kichi), Future Blessing
* 半吉 (han-kichi), Half-Blessing
* 吉 (kichi), Blessing
* 小吉 (shou-kichi), Small Blessing
* 中吉 (chuu-kichi), Middle Blessing
* 大吉 (dai-kichi), Great Blessing

The temples and shrines across Japan do not have a unified system for their omikuji. Some places do not offer the full range of fortunes, and a few offer an additional fortune rank:
* 平 (hira), Neutral

How the unmodified "Blessing" ranks compare to Small and Middle blessings also varies.

h4. See also

* [[tied omikuji]]
* [[chinese fortune sticks]]

title: chinese_fortune_sticks
body:
A fortune telling practice that originated in China in which a person poses questions and interprets answers from flat [[stick]]s inscribed with text or numerals and contained in a long cylindrical bamboo cup or [[tube]]. The practice is often performed in a [[Taoism|Taoist]] or [[Buddhism|Buddhist]] temple in front of an altar. 

h4. See also
* [[Omikuji]]

title: konoe_kanata
body:
A character from [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]]. Kanata is very sleepy and is prone to taking naps during the day, often carrying a [[pillow]] with her. She is very easygoing and prone to napping in the laps of others.

She has [[large breasts]] and [[long hair|long]], [[wavy hair|wavy]], [[brown hair|brown]] or [[orange hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[orange cardigan]] with [[sleeves past wrists]] under her winter uniform and a [[yellow jacket|yellow]] [[jacket]] on top of her summer uniform.

She is a member of [[QU4RTZ (love live!)|]].

Voiced by [[Kitou Akari]].

title: miyashita_ai
body:
A character in [[Love Live! Nijigasaki High School Idol Club]] and a second year student at Nijigasaki High School. Despite her gyaru style and flashy, loud appearance, Ai is a kindhearted, reliable girl who loves making puns.

She is a [[gyaru]] with [[yellow eyes|yellow]] or [[orange eyes|orange]] eyes and [[medium hair|shoulder-length]] [[blonde hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[bangs]]. At school she ties her hair into a [[half updo]] or a [[ponytail]] with a [[hair flower]]. In her free time she lets her her hair down except for a [[side braid]] on the front.

She wears a [[brown cardigan]] with her winter uniform instead of the regular black jacket, during summer she keeps the cardigan but ties it [[cardigan around waist|around her waist]] instead and wears a [[wrist scrunchie]] and [[bracelet]]s.

She is a member of [[DiverDiva]].

Voiced by [[Murakami Natsumi (voice actor)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: sakura_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Sakura[/b] (サクラ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The youngest princess of the Hoshidan royal family, she has a very shy personality, using honorifics even when talking to family members, but is strong-willed. She is the best healer in the army and her birthday is April 9th.

She is voiced by [[Kanemoto Hisako]] in the Japanese version and by Brianna Knickerbocker in the English version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Shrine Maiden (Cleric)

title: saizo_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Saizo[/b] (サイゾウ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A ninja of Hoshido, he is one of [[ryoma (fire emblem)|Ryoma]]'s personal retainers. He has taken a blood oath to serve Lord Ryouma absolutely. [[kaze (fire emblem)|Kaze]] is his twin brother.

He is voiced by Shigasa Tarusuke in the Japanese version and by Ben Diskin in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Ninja -> Master Ninja/Jounin

title: rinkah_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Rinkah[/b] (リンカ, [i]Rinka[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is from the Tribe of Flames, which is an independent group from the Kingdom. Following her father (the chief)'s orders, she moved to assist the Kingdom of Hoshido. In accordance with her tribe’s custom of honoring solitude, she does not interact with her comrades more than is necessary.

She is voiced by [[Ishikawa Yui]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Oni Savage

h4. Appearance

title: pan-chan_(blue_archive)
body:
Part monster, part culinary disaster created by [[juri_(blue_archive)|Juri]] from [[Blue Archive]]. It resembles a cross between a purple octopus and a stack of pancakes with green syrup poured over it.

In Pandemic Hazard, it was known to be Juri's creation, this culinary abomination is also edible despite the "odd" looking pancake. A huge version also appears.

title: kaden_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Kaden[/b] (ニシキ, [i]Nishiki[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A Kitsune youth who lives in a remote region of Hoshido. Following his father's footsteps, he acts as his clan's leader and keeps his people in order. Very concerned with his appearance, Nishiki is often found grooming himself, so that his fur remains in top condition. He apparently has the best attitude.

He is voiced by Yuuta Takahashi in the Japanese version and by Max Mittelman in the English localization.

body:
[b]Ignatius[/b] (イグニス, [i]Ignis[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

title: forrest_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Forrest[/b] (フォレオ, [i]Foleo[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Forrest is the son of [[leo (fire emblem fates)|Leo]] and the cousin of [[siegbert_(fire_emblem)|Siegbert]]. A notably kind, sympathetic young man, he also has a great fashion sense and excels at making clothes. He also suffers from hemophobia.

He is voiced by Yuuta Takahashi in the Japanese version and by Max Mittelman in the English localization. Forrest is the only character who shares his English voice actor with his own father.

title: hoshi_wo_miru_hito
body:
[b]Hoshi wo Miru Hito[/b] (lit. "Stargazer") is an RPG game developed by Another and published by HOT-B in 1987 for [[Famicom]]. Due to its glaring flaws, it's known as the "densetsu no kusoge" (伝説のクソゲー legendary shitty game). A patch was released to balance the game and improve the graphics in its subsequent release, and there even exist two fan remakes.

In May 2020, it was revealed that the game would receive a digital re-release on the Nintendo Switch in the summer later that year, and was released worldwide on July 30th. Despite the worldwide release, the game was not translated, meaning it's only in Japanese.

h4. See also
* [[Stargazer (series)|Stargazer]] (a fan remake released on 2009)
* [[Romancing Stella Visor]] (a fan remake released in 2015)

title: yuki_miku_(2023)
body:
The 2023 version of [[Yuki Miku]]. The theme of the design contest for this year was 空模様 (weather/condition of the sky) showing the imagery of Hokkaido winter.

The winning entry was drawn by [[isakysaku]] and features a daybreak motif with a pastel palette. The main visual was illustrated by [[ancotaku]].

Her [[light blue hair]] ends with a [[pink hair|pink]] [[gradient hair|gradient]]. She wears a [[bonnet]] with a pink [[bowtie]]. Her [[twintails]] are adorned with [[sun_hair_ornament|sun]] and [[crescent_hair_ornament|crescent moon]] hair ornaments. She carries a giant [[paintbrush]] which she uses to paint the sky of the new day.

She is given the fan nickname 冬麗ちゃん (Fuyu Urara-chan) in Japanese, meaning "clear/beautiful winter". Her English fan nickname is "Serenity":[https://twitter.com/isaky_tm/status/1565583293935980544].

Her theme song is [[SnowMix_(vocaloid)|]] by Marasy, with PV illustrated by [[Omutatsu]].

h4. Official art

body:

body:

Platforms covered with a red carpet ([[hinadan]]) are used to display a set of ornamental dolls ([[hina ningyou]]) representing the Emperor, Empress, attendants, and musicians in traditional court dress of the Heian period. title: god_cloth
body: The God Cloths, are a unique class of Cloths worn by [[Athena (Saint Seiya)|Athena]]'s Saints that have existed since the Age of Myth. Transformed by spilling Athena's blood on the original Cloths, these new Cloths provide their Saints a level of protection and power that surpasses that of Gold Saints and even some minor Gods, such as [[Thanatos (Saint Seiya)|Thanatos]] and [[Hypnos (Saint Seiya)|Hypnos]]  and are second only to the original armors of the 12 Olympians, the Kamui. In the manga the armor is completely golden, while in the anime each of the wearers (except the [[Gold Saint|12 Gold Saints]] and [[Phoenix Ikki|Ikki]]) has a unique color.

title: dragon_ball_heroes
body:
Developed by Bandai off the heels of [[Dragon Ball Z]] [[dragon ball kai|Kai]], [b]Dragon Ball Heroes[/b] is an arcade trading card game ([[carddass]]) using the [[Dragon Ball]] property, later renamed to [b]Super Dragon Ball Heroes[/b]. It is infamous in the West for its perceived fan service, giving characters access to forms they previously hadn't obtained/used, and just generally being absurd in its plotlines.

Starting with [i]Dragon Ball Heroes: God Mission[/i], more plot elements were introduced into the game (largely drawn from [[Dragon Ball Online]], similarly to [[Dragon Ball Xenoverse]] that same year), and has since developed it through several mediums, including the arcade game itself, its manga adaptations ([[Toyotarou]]'s Victory Mission, and the more faithful Nagayama Yoshitaka serializations), its handheld console adaptations on Nintendo platforms, and an anime adaptation starting from its-then-latest storyline, [i]Universe Mission[/i]. All of these adaptations have story elements that add or diverge from the original arcade game, and could thus be considered their own separate timelines to some extent, similarly to its relation to the Xenoverse series.

Dragon Ball Heroes would largely be confined to Japanese shores, but from July to October of 2018, the arcade game was shown in 7 North American towns as part of an American tour, marking its first appearance overseas. The 2019 game [i]Super Dragon Ball Heroes: World Mission[/i], the fourth console adaptation of the arcade game for Nintendo Switch, would be the first to not only properly release in English, but also internationally.

Dragon Ball Heroes would be retired by November 2024, to be replaced by a brand new arcade game in the form of "Dragon Ball Super Divers":[https://twitter.com/Venixys/status/1889963679992647949], which replaced its machines and features a legacy Heroes mode which players can access to make use of their cards still.

title: shidare_hotaru
body:
Main female character from [[Dagashi Kashi]]. She is an avid dagashi ([[sweets]]) enthusiast. 
She is trying to convince [[shikada_kokonotsu|Kokonotsu]] to inherit his father's shop.

Being from the city, she is a lot more fashionable than the other characters in the series. She wears [[ankle strap]] [[pumps]], a [[frills|frilled]] [[blouse]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[ribbon]] or [[red bow|red]] [[bow]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[high-waist_skirt|high-waist]] [[suspender skirt]], and [[black pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose|thighband]] [[pantyhose]]. (See also [[Virgin Killer Outfit]]; Hotaru serves as one of the codifiers of this style)

In terms of looks, she has [[purple hair|purple]] [[bob cut]] that reaches just above her shoulders, ornated with a [[black hairband]] with a [[black rose]], [[ringed_eyes|ringed]] [[purple eyes|purple]] or [[blue eyes]], and [[large breasts]].

It is rectangular in shape, with upper edges that taper outwards. Often features dangling accessories such as [[hat tassel|tassels]].

It is the iconic hat of [[Yanfei_(genshin_impact)|]] from [[Genshin Impact]].

title: swinging_on_swing
body:
When a character is using a [[swing]] to swing themselves around.

Should only be used when it is clear the character is swinging on the swing rather than only being [[on swing|on the swing]], which can be hard to determine with still images. Look for [[motion lines]], someone else [[pushing]] the character on the swing, or a character's pose indicating they are mid-swing.

h4.Correct examples
* !post #4712939: [[Sitting]] while swinging on a swing
* !post #7348319: [[Uesugi Fuutarou]] and [[Nakano Yotsuba]] [[standing on swing|standing on a swing]] while still swinging on it still

h4.Incorrect examples
* !post #6866877: Both [[Toga Himiko]] and [[Uraraka Ochaco]] sitting on a swing but not swinging on one
* !post #6034898: [[alice (alice in wonderland)|Alice]] only standing on a swing

title: aaron_paul
body: Aaron Paul (born Aaron Paul Sturtevant; August 27, 1979) is an American actor and producer. He is best known for portraying Jesse Pinkman in the AMC series [[Breaking Bad]] (2008–2013), for which he won several awards, including three Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Drama Series, a joint-record since its separation into comedy and drama, as well as a Golden Globe Award nomination. Paul also won the Saturn Award for Best Supporting Actor on Television a record three times. He reprised the role in the Netflix sequel film El Camino (2019), and during the final season of spin-off series [[Better Call Saul]] (2022).

body:
The first of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

Traditionally a practitioner of ordinary stage magic, the Magician became a [[wizard]] in occult decks designed for divination. The Magician usually has one hand pointing skyward and the other hand pointed to the ground. Many depictions of the Magician include items symbolizing the four suits of the Minor Arcana: a [[wand]], a [[cup]], a [[sword]] or [[knife]], and a [[pentacle]] or [[coin]].

title: charlotte_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is a mercenary of the border of the Kingdom of Nohr. She appears to be a truly kind girl to anyone who talks to her, but this is just a ruse to get any man under her control. Her true nature is that of a strong yet crude hand-to-hand fighter. She dreams of marrying into high wealth and social status.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[blonde hair]], [[blue eyes]], [[large breasts]] and prominent [[lips]]. She wears a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow|hair]] [[bow]] and a [[bikini armor|skimpy]] [[armor|armored]] outfit.

She is voiced by Shimizu Ai in the Japanese version and by Brianna Knickerbocker in the English localization. Her starting class is Fighter, making her the first female Fighter in the series.

h4. Appearance

* !post #4647854
* !post #2740549: [[charlotte (money maiden) (fire emblem)|Money Maiden]]

title: delta_force_(video_game)
body: Delta Force is a FPS video game series originally developed by NovaLogic and now currently owned by [[tencent_qq|TiMi Studio Group]]. Taking the role as a member of Delta Force, a [[real life]] [[Military Operator|Special Forces]] group of the [[United States Army]], the player is tasked all over the world to battle terrorists, international criminals, rebels and enemy military forces.

title: beruka_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Beruka[/b] (ベルカ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She serves under [[Camilla (fire emblem)|]] as a go getting hitwoman. She has an expressionless face and is taciturn, leading her to be a person who projects an inhospitable aura. She joined as Camilla's favorite "strong woman" and thus is her right hand.

She is voiced by Tazawa Masumi in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Wyvern Rider

h4. Appearance 

* !post #2618711

title: benny_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Benny[/b] (ブノワ, [i]Benoit[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A border guard serving the Kingdom of Nohr. The same as Charlotte. He is a great man with a scary face that both his allies and enemies fear. However, he is nice inside, somewhat cowardly, and always thinking of his comrades. He carries a homemade charm with him into battle.

Benny is extremely tall and very [[muscular male| muscular]], has [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]], [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], as well as a [[scar on forehead|scar on his forehead]]. He wears [[black armor|black]] [[armor]] into battle.

He is voiced by Kiyama Shigeo in the Japanese version and by Imari Williams in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Knight

h4. Appearance

* !post #4806578

title: arthur_(fire_emblem_fates)
body:
[b]Arthur[/b] (ハロルド, [i]Harold[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

[[Elise (fire emblem)|]]'s subordinate. He crushes evil and protects justice, He's a Hero of Justice, specifically! He has always followed the path of the righteous, all his life, like the waves flow he has obeyed this rule. He has extremely bad luck, which is even reflected in gameplay by his abysmal Luck stat and growth. [spoiler]However, his luck is said to improve in his old age.[/spoiler]

He is voiced by Kitazawa Riki in the Japanese version and by Cam Clarke in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Fighter 

h4. Appearance

* !post #2499998

title: sophie_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Sophie[/b] (ゾフィー, Zofi) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Sophie is the daughter of [[silas_(fire_emblem)|Silas]]. Sophie is extremely prone to making mistakes, but is always optimistic and cheerful. She talks to herself more than anyone.

She is voiced by Sakura Nakamura in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cavalier

h4. Appearance

* !post #2246430

title: midori_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is the daughter of [[kaze (fire emblem)|Kaze]], niece of [[saizo_(fire_emblem)|Saizo]], and cousin of [[asugi_(fire_emblem)|Asugi]]. Has the most acute sense of taste.

She is voiced by [[Kouno Marika]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Herb Merchant

* !post #3852231

body:
The twenty-first of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

The World is traditionally represented by a woman [[floating|hovering]] above the Earth, with a [[wand]] in each hand, surrounded by a [[wreath]]. In many decks, The World has four creatures watching from its corners: an [[eagle]], a [[lion]], an [[bull|ox]], and a human.

title: dwyer_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Dwyer[/b] (ディーア, [i]Deere[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Deere is the son of [[jakob_(fire_emblem)|Jakob]]. Deere is normally seen competing against his father in some form or manner. Although lazy and apathetic, his motto is "work before rest". He is a naturally skilled butler and at combat. He has the most hidden talents.

He is voiced by Yuuichi Iguchi in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Rod Knight

* !post #2208249

body:

The Moon is traditionally depicted by a night scene in which a [[dog]] and a [[wolf]] howl at the [[full moon]] while a [[lobster]] reaches up from the water.

title: shura_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Shura[/b] (アシュラ, [i]Asura[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A thief from Nohr. Born in the Principality of Kouga. It is hard to say if he is a "good person", but he is kind and good at taking care of people. He is the best long-distance swimmer out of everyone in the army.

He is voiced by Madoka Shiga in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Adventurer

h4. Appearance

* !post #2286979

title: izana_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Izana[/b] (イザナ) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Ruler of the Principality of Izumo. He has an unexpectedly cheerful and joking personality in contrast to his beautiful and divine appearance.

He is voiced by Toochika Kouichi in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Onmyoji

h4. Appearance

* !post #8129407

title: silas_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Silas[/b] (サイラス, [i]Sairasu[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

A new knight in the Kingdom of Nohr, and [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar)'s childhood friend. He has a kind heart and puts his friends before himself at all times. However, he is a very wary person as well, one who would sacrifice himself for an ally who had let their guard down.

He is voiced by Okumura Shou in the Japanese version and by Antony Del Rio in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Cavalier

h4. Appearance

* !post #3384669

body:

* !post #2957536

title: kaze_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Kaze[/b] (スズカぜ, [b]Sukukaze[/b] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Hails from a family that has served the Hoshidan royal family for generations. He does not serve a particular master, and so just serves the castle itself. He is polite and has quite a composed personality.

He is voiced by [[Ono Daisuke]] in the Japanese version and by David Stanbra in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Ninja

h4. Appearance

* !post #3100250

title: jakob_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Jakob[/b] (ジョーカー [i]Joker[/i] in the Japanese version) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

Serves as a steward to [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar) within the Kingdom of Nohr. He has keen intellect, and does everything from housework to odd jobs with great skill. However, he is rather unsociable to anybody who is not the Avatar.

He is voiced by [[Suwabe Jun'ichi]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Butler

h4. Appearance

* !post #2619743
* !post #2907140: [[jakob (devoted monster) (fire emblem)|Devoted Monster]]

title: felicia_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Felicia[/b] (フェリシア, [i]Ferishia[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

The maid who serves [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar) by doing all the tasks they need in the Kingdom of Nohr. While she is brave and tries her best, she still makes a lot of mistakes.

She is voiced by [[Sasaki Nozomi]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Maid

h4. Appearance

* !post #2481814

title: azura_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Azura[/b] (アクア Akua, Aqua) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

She is the opposite of [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar), having been born in Nohr but kidnapped and raised in Hoshido. After she meets the protagonist, she travels with them no matter what choice they make. She holds a special power in the songs she sings.

She is voiced by Lynn in the Japanese version. Her singing voice is provided by Renka. In the English localization, Rena Strober provides both her voice acting and singing.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Songstress

title: class_d51
body:
The Class D51 (D51形) is a type of 2-8-2 [[steam locomotive|steam]] [[locomotive]] built by the [[Japan Railways|Japanese Government Railways]] ([[Japan Railways|JGR]]), the [[Japan Railways|Japanese National Railways]] ([[Japan Railways|JNR]]), and Kawasaki Heavy Industries Rolling Stock Company, Kisha Seizo, Hitachi, Nippon Sharyo, Mitsubishi, and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries from 1936 to 1945 and 1950 to 1951. 174 units are in preservation in Japan, including five operational examples. A further 13 are preserved in Russia and Taiwan, bringing the total number of preserved units to 187.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23073815: D51 Steam Locomotive
* !asset #23073832: D51 in freight operation of the JNR days
* !asset #23073836: D51 Semi-Streamlined Variant
* !asset #25084809: D51 Streamlined Variant
* !post #6834291: Goto Factory Smoke Deflector 

h4. See also

* [[Japan Railways]]
* [[East Japan Railway Company]]
* [[West Japan Railway Company]]
* [[Steam Locomotive]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: JNR Class D51":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JNR_Class_D51

The Tower, in most decks, is represented by a [[tower]] being [[destruction|destroyed]]. It may be struck by [[lightning]] or crumbling due to some other destructive force.

title: mushoku_tensei
body:
Full title: 無職転生 〜異世界行ったら本気だす〜 ([i]Mushoku Tensei: Isekai Ittara Honki Dasu[/i], lit. [i]Jobless Reincarnation: I Will Seriously Try If I Go to Another World[/i]).

An isekai light novel series about a jobless and hopeless man who reincarnates in a fantasy world while keeping his memories, determined to live his new life without regrets. Illustrated by [[Shirotaka (5choume)|]].

A manga adaptation began serialization in June 2014. An anime adaptation premiered in January 2021.

The Hierophant is usually drawn in religious garb with a [[mitre]] and holding a triple [[cross]], traditionally associated with the [[pope]]. Symbolic depictions of the Hierophant show him on a [[throne]] between two pillars, with worshipers at his feet.

The Empress is traditionally a woman seated on a [[throne]], wearing a monarch's [[crown]] and holding a [[scepter]]. In many decks, the Empress is [[pregnant]]. Her throne may be situated in a [[field]] of grain or lush vegetation.

title: the_high_priestess_(tarot)
body:
The second of the Major Arcana cards in a [[tarot]] deck.

In older tarot decks designed for card games, the High Priestess is [i]La Papesse[/i], a female [[pope]]. Occult tarot decks surround the High Priestess with esoteric symbolism; she wears a crown like that of the goddess [[hathor_(mythology)|Hathor]], she sits between "two pillars labeled B and J":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boaz_and_Jachin, she holds a [[book]] or [[scroll]], and the [[moon]] is at her feet.

title: warship_girls_r
body:
[b]Warship Girls R[/b] (战舰少女 [i]Zhan Jian Shao Nyu[/i]) is a shipgirl-themed Chinese smartphone game.

Gameplay is similar to [[Kantai Collection]]. However, unlike [[Kantai Collection]], where most of the ships originally came from the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], Warship Girls R from the start featured ships from various naval forces around the world. 

h4. History

The game was initially released by "Suzhou Paiqu Network Technology":[http://www.p7game.com/], as Warship Girls, for Android and iOS devices in September, 2014.

In July 2015 there was a split between the publisher of the game and its developer, MoeFantasy (幻萌), and from then on each company developed and released its own version of the game, which differed in available characters, interface design, etc.

On August 29th 2015 at ComiCon16, Shanghai, MoeFantasy revealed via trailer the development of [i]Project R[/i], a major overhaul of the game including new features, updated UI and a new animated combat system. This version was released in November the same year as client version 2.0 and was dubbed 战舰少女R (Warship Girls R). The MoeFantasy version would become the main focus of all community efforts, from wikis to drop data libraries and fan works.

On June 23rd 2016, it was announced on the community's Baidu forum and later as official statements that a settlement had been reached between the two companies. SPNT shut down its servers on September in the same year.

On October 24th 2017, a Japanese translated version and server released under the name 戦艦少女R, or Senkan Shoujo R.

On December 18th 2018, a Global server and Korean server were officially released.

Also in 2018, on September 8th, a spinoff was released that was made by MoeFantasy's Japanese branch, entitled 蒼青のミラージュ or [[steelblue mirage|MiST: The Mirage of Steelblue]]. Due to various reasons, it became unavailable on March 15th, 2020, with refunds beginning at the same time, ending on June 15th.

The Global server and Korean server were shut down on the 31st of August, 2021.

h4. See also

* [[Kantai Collection]]
* [[Azur Lane]]
* [[Blue Oath]]
* [[Victory Belles]]
* [[Remodel (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[List of Warship Girls R characters]]

title: water_rocket
body:
A water rocket is a type of model rocket that uses water as its reaction mass. The water is forced out via a pressurized gas, typically compressed air.  These kinds of rockets are frequently constructed out of [[plastic bottle]]s, which is why these kinds of rockets are also known as "bottle rockets."

title: pezun_dwadge
body:
A fictional manned combat giant robot from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse. It was introduced in the original design series [[Gundam MS-X]].
 
[b]MS-10 Pezun Dowadge[/b]

An experimental high mobility [[mobile suit]] developed at the [[asteroid]] base [i]Pezun[/i] as part of the secretive "[[Zeon]] Pezun Project". It was a direct successor to the [[dom_(mobile_suit)|MS-09 Dom]]. 

The Pezun Dowadge's relationship with the similarly-named MS-09G [[Dwadge]] remains uncertain to this day.

title: among_us
body:
A social intrigue party game developed and published in 2018 by InnerSloth, in which players are randomly divided into [[Crewmate (among us)|]]s and  [[Impostor (among us)|]]s. The Crewmates must attempt to complete all required tasks and/or expose the Impostors, while the secret Impostors must [[murder]] or frame the Crewmates or sabotage the Crewmates' efforts.

Although released in 2018 as a relatively little-known game, it had a sudden boom in popularity in September 2020, with regular concurrent numbers of well over 250,000, reaching widespread [[meme|memetic]] fame. The game would later spawn a wide variety of post-ironic [[meme|memes]] a year later, usually revolving around a parody of [[Stonetoss (style)|]] comics, a [[when the imposter is sus (meme)|photoshopped image]] of [[Jerma985]], anything that looks like the in-game characters and/or having the name sounded like "Among Us/Amogus" or "Sus", or simply using the in-game character itself as a "punchline".

title: hop_on_among_us_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a Tumblr image of [[yuri|two anime girls]] [[kiss]]ing with the caption "Hop on [[Among Us]]". The phrase took on a double meaning as an ironic slang term used to ask someone if they want to have gay sex, essentially calling the game's players "gay,"

The meme later spawned numerous derivatives involving an image or [[animated GIF]] of either a [[yaoi|gay]] or [[yuri|lesbian]] couple kissing with the name of the targeted game (and fanbase) being changed accordingly.

h4. External links
* "KnowYourMeme: Hop On Among Us":https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/hop-on-among-us

title: renaissance
body:
Generally known as "The Renaissance". The period of European history from around 1450-1600, when knowledge of and interest in classic Greek and Roman art and literature flourished and led to massive changes in European art and literature, predominately in Italy and France but also seen in England, Spain and the Holy Roman Empire (modern Germany).

Some of the larger names associated with this period are Leonardo da Vinci, Michaelangelo and William Shakespeare. The word comes from the French word for "rebirth".

title: hercule_poirot
body:
[b]Hercule Poirot[/b] is a fictional Belgian Detective created by British writer Agatha Christie. He is Agatha's most famous and longest-running character, appearing in 33 novels, two plays and 51 short stories published between 1920 and 1975.

In the novels, Hercule is a former police detective for the Belgian Police before being forced to move to Britain after his country was invaded by Germany during [[World War I]]. After settling in his new home country, Poirot becomes a private detective who offers his services to solve cases and murders throughout Britain and abroad. Other recurring characters in the novels include Captain Arthur Hastings, a former British Army officer and Poirot's companion, Mrs Ariadne Oliver, a detective novelist whose a humorous self-caricature of Agatha herself, Miss Felicity Lemon, Poirot's secretary and Chief Inspector James Harold Japp of Scotland Yard, who often hires Poirot in difficult cases.

The Poirot novels has been adapted many times with the most famous being the ITV series [I]Agatha Christie's Poirot[/I], which ran from 1989 to 2013 with David Suchet as Poirot, whose portrayal as the character being the most well received. A 39 episodes anime adaptation of the novels, [[agatha christie no meitantei poirot to marple|Agatha Christie's Great Detectives Poirot and Marple]], aired from 4 July 2004 to 15 May 2005 on NHK. Currently there is a Hercule Poirot film series directed by Kenneth Branagh with Poirot portrayed by Kenneth himself. As of 2025, Kenneth has directed three Poirot films, Murder on the Orient Express (2017), Death on the Nile (2022) and A Haunting in Venice (2023).

title: armbar
body:
The armbar or the jūji-gatame (十字固, rendered as "Ude-Hishigi-Juji-Gatame") is an official Kodokan [[Judo]] technique. 

The English word "bar" is used here to signify the opponent's extended arm, while the Japanese word "jūji" (十字) refers to the armbar's visual resemblance to the number 10 as written in kanji, 十. The word jūji is also found in "jūjika" (十字架), meaning a cross.
 
In general, the practitioner secures an arm at the wrist of the opponent, trapping it by squeezing the knees together. The attacker's legs end up across the opponent's chest, with the arm held between the thighs, with the elbow pointing against the thigh or hips. By holding the opponent's wrist to the attacker's chest with the pinky finger on the sternum and the thumb facing up (arm semi-supinated or semi-pronated), the practitioner can easily extend the opponent's arm and hyperextend the opponent's elbow. The attacker can further increase the pressure on the elbow joint by arching their hips against the elbow.

h4. See also
* [[judo]]
* [[martial arts]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armlock]

body: A rhythm game series developed by Sonic Team and published by Sega. In the game, players use maracas—special controllers that resemble the musical instrument—to shake in time with Latin music tracks, following on-screen prompts to match the rhythm.

title: domino_(pokemon)
body:
A member of [[Team Rocket]] who appeared in the Pokemon TV special [i]Mewtwo Returns[/i] as its secondary antagonist.

She has [[blonde hair]] that she styles in [[twin drills]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears the [[Team Rocket uniform]] with her [[black shirt]] complemented by [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[white boots|white]] [[thigh boots]], and [[white skirt]]. She wears a [[belt]] with front-facing [[belt buckle]]. Her hat is mostly [[pink hat|pink]], but the front panel is white. Her code name is Black Tulip, so she sometimes is depicted with a [[black tulip]].

title: cecil_carna
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance]] series, introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and reintroduced in [[Rance x]].

In [[Kichikuou Rance]], Cecil is a mercenary employed by [[Pluepet]], who can be hired by [[Rance]] for gold. She cannot be called into his harem, however, making Cecil one of the few women without any sexual content involving her.

In [[Rance x]], she is an independent leader of a Mercenary Guild who leads the defense of the Free Cities Alliance, and the lover of [[Arios Theoman]].

title: la_hawzel
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|]] series, introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and returns in [[Rance x]].

A former [[Angel]], La Hawzel is a Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Hornet (rance)|]] Faction, and the twin sister of [[La Seizel]], who is affiliated with the [[Kayblis]] Faction. Unlike her volatile, selfish sister, Hawzel is calm, compassionate, and close friends with Hornet.

title: kayblis
body: A main antagonist in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and [[Rance x]]. The oldest and most powerful Dark Lord in the Rance world, he is a grotesque, deer-like figure possessing six arms and eight penises. He, alongside his faction, schemes to usurp [[Hornet (Rance)|]] and kill [[Kurusu Miki]] to become the Demon King, and rule all of Monsterkind.

title: hawlean_province
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance series]], introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and reintroduced in [[Rance x]].

In both games, Hawlean (or Haurein in the English version) is a strict, dutiful commander of the Leazas White Army, and the estranged daughter of [[Barres Province]]. In [i]Kichikuou[/i], she participates in the rebellion against King [[Rance]] at the start of the game, led by her superior [[Ex Banquet]].

title: lei_gatthon
body:
Character in the [[Rance (series)|Rance series]], introduced in [[Kichikuou Rance]] and later revamped for [[Rance x]].

In [[Kichikuou Rance]], Lei is an aloof Dark Lord affiliated with the [[Kayblis]] Faction, who possesses a romantic relationship with an elderly woman named [[Mary Ann (Rance)|]]. Depending on the player's actions, Lei can be killed by holding Mary Ann hostage or by fighting him directly.

In [[Rance x]], while Lei remains as a member of the Kayblis Faction, his relationship with Mary Ann is significantly altered. In this game, Lei meets Mary Ann as a child and befriends her, and does not become romantically involved with her until she reaches adulthood in Part 2. The player is also given the option to spare and recruit Lei, unlike in [i]Kichikuou[/i]

title: asashimo_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Asashimo[/i]. Character designed by [[Fujikawa]], voiced by [[Kayano Ai]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair]] ([[grey hair|grey]] on the outside and [[purple hair|purple]] on the inside) and tied to a [[ponytail]], [[hair over one eye|hair covering her right eye]], [[grey eyes]], [[sharp teeth]], and [[small breasts]]. 

Her default outfit is the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[school uniform]] which consists of a purple [[halterneck]] [[dress]] over a [[white shirt]], a teal-blue [[bowtie]] and [[grey pantyhose|grey]]/[[purple pantyhose|purple]] opaque [[pantyhose]] with [[lace-up boots]]. Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life funnel and mast as a backpack, a 12.7 cm twin gun mount, and 61 cm quad [[torpedo tubes]] on [[thigh strap]]s. 

On her kai form, she gains a white [[headband]], AA guns and a [[single thighhigh]] on her left leg is overlaid on her pantyhose (emulating [[Yamato (Kancolle)|]] as an [[Operation Ten-Gou]] participant).

title: asashimo_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The kai ni form of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Asashimo (kancolle)|]]. 

When it was first implemented on October 25, 2019, she first wore the [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[winter uniform]]. It consists of a short grey [[blazer]] over the dress which now has a sheer black underskirt. Her pantyhose has also been reduced to [[thighhighs]] in the same seamed style. Her differing characteristics are that she the [[sleeves rolled up|sleeves of her blazer are slightly rolled up]] and she wears [[mismatched legwear|differently colored]] thighhighs, her right the standard [[grey thighhighs]] and her left [[black thighhigh|blackish/dark grey]]. 

She later gets the standard [i]Yuugumo[/i]-class [[summer uniform]], consisting of a violet [[vest]] over a [[white shirt|white]] [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] blouse, a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] purple skirt with a sheer black underskirt, black gauntlet-like [[fingerless gloves]], and the abovementioned differently colored thighhighs.

title: threo_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character and one of the Eternals. Her name in Japanese is "Saraasa" or "thalaatha/ثلاثة", which is Arabic for "three".

Wielder of the Three Tiger Axe, a fierce warrior who understands the laws of nature which is her creed. Born and raised away from human civilization, Threo relies mostly on her natural instincts and senses whether in and out of combat. This trait and her mentality and desire to become stronger to "reach the top of the food chain" even caused her peers to compare her to a wild beast.

Voiced by [[Takayama Minami]].

title: cable_(marvel)
body: [b]Cable[/b], a.k.a. [b]Nathan Christopher Charles Summers[/b] or [b]Nathan Dayspring[/b], is a character appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]], commonly in association with X-Force and the [[X-Men]]. Nathan first appeared as the newborn son of [[Scott Summers]] and [[Madelyne Pryor]] in The Uncanny X-Men #201 (Jan. 1986) created by writer Chris Claremont and penciler Rick Leonardi, while Cable first appeared in The New Mutants #87 (March 1990) created by writer Louise Simonson and artist/co-writer [[Rob Liefeld]]. Cable's origin initially was undecided and he was assumed to be a separate character, but it was later decided that he was actually an older version of Nathan due to being a time traveler.

title: mark_hamill
body:
[b]Mark Richard Hamill[/b] (b. September 25, 1951)

American actor and [[voice actor]].

Became famous for portraying the character of [[Luke Skywalker]] in the [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|space opera]] movie franchise in his youth during the 70s and 80s, a role he returned to play during the new sequel trilogy of films (and net series) produced by [[Disney]], he even played Luke in some parodies like [[Robot Chicken]] and [[Family Guy]].

Also a [[otaku|notable comic book collector]] and accomplished voice actor, quite popular for his role as the crazy [[DC comics]] villain [[Joker (dc)|]] in many animated series, movies and video games.

h4.Partial filmography
h6. Movies (live action)

* [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens|Star Wars Episode VII - The Force Awakens]]

title: luke_skywalker
body:
Main protagonist of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|Sci-Fi]] and [[Fantasy]] series.
 
He was played by American actor [[Mark Hamill]] in the three original films from the 70s and 80s and also in the new sequel trilogy of films and net series produced by [[Disney]].

Luke Skywalker is a farm boy from the backwater world of Tatooine who famously destroys the [[Death Star]] and becomes the Rebel Alliance's greatest hero. Under the guidance of [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Yoda]], Luke learns about his family as the son of fallen Jedi [[Anakin Skywalker]], and learns the ways of the Force, becoming a [[Jedi]] himself.

title: lay's_(potato_chips)
body:
Popular brand of [[potato chips]]. The brand is also referred to as Frito-Lay, as both Lay's and Fritos are brands sold by the Frito-Lay company, which has been a wholly owned subsidiary of PepsiCo since 1965.
Frito-Lay primarily uses the brand name "Lay's" in the United States, and uses other brand names in some other countries, including Walkers (UK and [[Ireland]]); Smith's ([[Australia]]); Chipsy ([[Egypt]] and the West Balkans); Tapuchips ([[Israel]]); Margarita ([[Colombia]]); and [[Sabritas]] ([[Mexico]]).

title: ultimate_spider-man_(2000)
body:
The original Ultimate Spider-Man comic run, which ran from 2000 to 2010. Ultimate Spider-Man was a reboot of the [[Spider-Man]] story within Marvel's Ultimate timeline, essentially retelling the original Amazing Spider-Man story in the 00s. 

In 2011 the series was relaunched as [b]Ultimate Comics: Spider-Man[/b] to coincide with the debut of [[Miles Morales]] as the new protagonist.

A [[ultimate spider-man|cartoon series]] of the same name began airing in 2012 but had little in common with the comics. Marvel launched a new [[Ultimate Spider-Man (2024)|]] series in 2024 as part of the new Ultimate Universe that was launched in 2023.

title: velcro
body:
Velcro (also known as a hook and loop fastener) is a fastening system consisting of a piece of fabric of small hooks that sticks to a corresponding fabric of small loops.  It produces a distinctive ripping sound when separating the two pieces.

Due to its ease of use compared to alternative fastening systems like [[buttons]] and [[zipper|zippers]], it is a common feature for clothing for [[child|children]], elderly, and the disabled who may have difficulty with laces, buttons, and zippers.

[i]Due to the prominence of the Velcro Brand, hook-and-loop fasteners are often referred to by the genericized trademark [b]velcro[/b] in English. Compare to adhesive bandage → [[bandaid]].[/i]

title: asterios_(persona)
body: Asterios is a persona from the persona 4 arena game(s). He appears as a gigantic minotaur-like monster that is partially submerged in the ground, his head appears to be a large skull of a bull with metal attachments, chains, and partially sawed off horns that spew a reddish fire from the gouged out core. His body is mostly submerged, but appears to be a muscular humanoid that is colored black and is covered in chains that tie him to the earth, as well as having bone covered fists that he uses to beat his enemies to a pulp. Asterios is the persona of Shadow Labrys, although this fact is occasionally debated, as shadows (excluding Teddie) don't have Personas, only transformations into symbolic monsters, thus, Asterios is thought to be a mere extension of Shadow Labrys herself and symbolizes Labrys's desire for destruction.

title: koromaru_(persona)
body:
[[Albino]] [[shiba inu]] and member of S.E.E.S. in [[Persona 3]]. Despite being a [[dog]], Koromaru can summon a Persona, using a special collar as an [[evoker]].  He also wears a vest with angel wings (Yukari and Fuuka's idea) and a S.E.E.S. armband just like the rest of the party.  

Modeled on the story of Hachiko, a Shiba-Inu who continued to wait for his master everyday at the station long after his death, he displays exceptional intelligence and loyalty.  

* DOB: Unknown
* Zodiac: Unknown
* Persona: [[Cerberus (persona)|]]
* Weapons: Knife
* Arcana: The Strength (no social link)

title: beanie
body:
A tight-fitting knitted [[hat]] traditionally designed to keep the head warm in cold weather. Common styles of wear include hugging the head with a turned-up cuff, or leaving a few inches of the top unstretched to flop or stick up. 

Some knit beanies have [[pom pom beanie|pom pom]] balls at the top, and some have [[earflap beanie|earflaps]].

Also known as a tuque.

h4. Notable characters

* [[Bito Daisukenojo]] ([[Subarashiki Kono Sekai]])
* [[Dawn (pokemon)|]] ([[Pokemon]])
* [[Zerozaki Maiori]] ([[Zaregoto Series]])

h4. See also

* [[winter clothes]]
* [[propeller hat]] (another type of hat sometimes called a beanie)
* [[Tag group:Headwear]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Beanie":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beanie

He is best friends with the silent protagonist [[Yuuki Makoto (persona 3)|]]. His usual attire is a blue jacket and cap.

Initial Persona: [[Hermes (persona)|]]
Ultimate Persona: [[Trismegistus (persona)|]]

title: yuuki_makoto_(persona_3)
body:
The silent male protagonist from [[Persona 3]].

Unlike the rest of S.E.E.S, he has the ability to perceive the [[Velvet Room]] and the "Wild Card" ability to use, draw, and fuse multiple Personas.

His name is Arisato Minato in the manga, Shiomi Sakuya in the stage play adaptation, and Yuuki Makoto in the anime movie. Among fans his nickname is Kitarou, because he resembles [[Kitarou]] from [[GeGeGe no Kitarou]] in his [[hair over one eye]].

Initial Persona: [[Orpheus (persona)|]] (male version)
Middle Persona: [[Thanatos (persona)|]]
Ultimate Persona: [[Messiah (persona)|]]
h4. See also

* [[Shiomi Kotone]]

title: horned_melon
body:
An oval-shaped [[fruit]] from the same family as [[cucumber]] and [[melon]], and is traditional food plant in Africa. It has horn-like spines and red to yellow color when ripe. The fruit's taste has been compared to a combination of banana and passionfruit, cucumber and zucchini, or a combination of banana, cucumber and lime.

title: kaito_(vocaloid)
body:
KAITO is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed by the YAMAHA Corporation and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the first VOCALOID engine. He was later adopted by Crypton as an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[blue hair]] and wears a white [[coat]], brown [[pants]], and a blue [[scarf]]. He is frequently viewed as liking [[ice cream]]s.

He is voiced by the singer Fuuga Naoto. His first appearance was illustrated by [[Kawasaki Takashi]], with the his [[KAITO (Vocaloid3)|second appearance]], for VOCALOID3, being by [[iXima]].

title: tio_klarus
body:
Tio Klarus is one of the main female protagonists from the [[arifureta shokugyou de sekai saikyou|Arifureta]] series.

Tio is the princess of the exiled dragonmen and later becomes one of [[Nagumo Hajime]]'s companions. She becomes a perverted masochist after her first encounter with [[Nagumo Hajime|Hajime]] while being brainwashed by Yukitoshi Shimizu.

title: mihaly_a_shilage
body: The "rival" ace from [[Ace Combat 7]], nicknamed "Mister X." He serves as a test pilot for the Erusean Air Force, with data collected from his flights and engagements serving to help program his country's drone fighters. His full name is Mihaly Dumitru Margareta Corneliu Leopold Blanca Karol Aeon Ignatius Raphael Maria Niketas A. Shilage. He typically flies an [[Su-30]] Flanker, with a dark grey body and bright orange wingtips. [spoilers]In his final duel against [[trigger_(ace_combat)|Trigger]], he would use an [[X-02S Strike Wyvern]] with the same livery.[/spoilers] Also a highly skilled veteran pilot that never lets his victims escape.

title: kei_(ryuu_ga_gotoku)
body: Kei is a Japanese-American hostess that appears in [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 7 Gaiden]], [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 8]] and [[Ryuu ga Gotoku 8 Gaiden]] . She is both modeled and voiced by [[Kson]], a major fan of the Like A Dragon series. Furthermore, she is the only character to share the same voice actor for both the Japanese and English version of the games.

title: elevator
body:
A type of vertical transport equipment that efficiently moves people or goods between floors (levels, decks) of a building, vessel or other structures. Elevators are generally powered by electric motors that either drive traction cables or counterweight systems like a hoist, or pump hydraulic fluid to raise a cylindrical piston like a jack.

title: beatrice_castiglioni
body:
[b]Major spoilers below.[/b]

Character from [[Umineko no Naku Koro ni]]. Also referred to as "Bīce" (BEE-chee).

[spoiler][[ushiromiya_kinzou|Kinzo Ushiromiya]]'s one and only lover. Her father was an Italian army official, and she accompanied him on a secret mission for the Salo Republic involving the transportation of 10 tons of gold. Traveling by submarine, the crew hit a mine and (with many casualities, including Beatrice's father) were barely able to take refuge on a small Japanese military base on Rokkenjima, where Kinzo was stationed.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]By speaking to each other, Kinzo and Beatrice dearly understood their respective sympathies and fell in love. On Rokkenjima, the Japanese and Italian armies proceeded to slaughter each other over the gold that the Italians transported, with Kinzo and Beatrice being the sole survivors. Beatrice was hurt in the crossfire, and was brought to [[nanjou_terumasa|Terumasa Nanjo]] by Kinzo to be treated. Afterwards, they started a secret relationship on Rokkenjima (due to Kinzo being married already) and eventually produced a child. Beatrice died during childbirth, and Kinzo named the child "[[ushiromiya_beatrice|Beatrice Ushiromiya]]" in her honor.[/spoiler]
other_names: ベアトリーチェ・カスティリオーニ

title: caustics
body:
Patterns of [[light]] projected onto a surface by light rays reflected off or refracted through another object. These can be seen on underwater surfaces, when light passes through materials like [[water]], glass, and the like. The bright ripples you can see on the bottom of a [[pool]] or on things close to it on a sunny day are this.

* !post #4150718

h4. See also

* [[Refraction]]

* [[reflective_water|Reflective water]]

title: dawn_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Dawn[/b], known as [b]Hikari[/b] (ヒカリ) in Japan, is the female player character in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon dppt|Diamond and Pearl]][/i].

This friendly and upbeat Trainer packs quite a punch, thanks to her travels in Sinnoh. Despite her skill as a Trainer, she can be a little scatterbrained at times [tn](official bio)[/tn].

She has [[grey eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[blue hair]]. She wears a [[white headwear|white]] [[poke ball print|print]] [[beanie]], [[hairclip|hairclips]], a [[red scarf]], a [[black shirt|black]] [[sleeveless shirt]], a [[bracelet]], a [[poketch|Pokétch]], a [[pink skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], [[pink footwear|pink]] [[boots]], and a [[yellow bag|yellow]] [[duffel bag|bag]].

Her [[Pokemon Adventures]] counterpart is [b]Platinum Berlitz[/b].

title: helel_ben_sahar_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
[[Granblue Fantasy]] character. One of [[Bahamut_(shingeki_no_bahamut)|]]'s Speakers.

[spoiler] Created by the Omnipotent as a Speaker, their servant, he was given the name Helel ben Sahar and was tasked with spreading the Omnipotent's words and their will among the people of the realm they created. He chose not to interfere in his master's conflict with ancient humans even after it resulted in the splitting of the Omnipotent into two conflicting and opposed sides; the god of the skies and the god of the stars. The sky god wished to recreate the sky realm while the Astral god opted to leave and create an entirely new world based on the one they had left, neither paying attention to the fate of the Speaker. Still, he continued to await contact from his master so he might continue fulfilling his role as Speaker. For thousands of years he took on the role of observer, watching over the two realms as they changed and evolved, acting only to deal with threats outwith the gods' powers.

Sensing an upcoming calamity that could befall the sky realm and wishing to protect the world his master created and its inhabitants, he decided to join the Singularity, the only known living human with the power to alter course of fate itself, assuming a new name to hide his true identity as a god's servant - Lucio.

In time the predicted calamity was revealed to have been set in motion by [[lucilius_(granblue_fantasy)|Lucilius]], who wished to bring an end to the entire sky realm. Initially Lucio tried to convince Lucilius to abandon his plan and his rebellion against gods, hoping to reach some common understanding as Lucilius was an Astral created in Lucio's image. But negotiations failed and Lucio was forced to feign being defeated by Lucilius, waiting inside the latter's core for the right moment to trap Lucilius in a space between dimensions which would serve as an eternal prison.

After the calamity was halted and the visible threat was dealt with, he started to wonder if he still needed to perform his duties and if his master's wishes could really be good for this world. After all, it was not only the power of Supreme Primarch that saved the world but the combined strength of many different forces. He started to wonder if perhaps the world's current state was already perfect and no longer in need of evolution thanks to living creatures and their ability to support each other and compensate their own weaknesses. He confronted the Singularity with these mixed feelings in a dream. After reaffirming himself in his new stance, he left his role as observer and decided that it was fine to simply continue living on and to use his powers for the well-being of the skies. Aboard the Grandcypher alongside Singularity and their crew, he waits for the day when he can ask his master the true purpose behind himself, the world, and all living beings. [/spoiler]

For his other identity, see [[Lucio (granblue fantasy)|]].

Her default outfit consists of a [[sleeveless dress|sleeveless]] [[double-breasted]] [[red dress]] with a short [[pelvic curtain]], [[black boots|black]] [[thigh boots]], [[red cape]], and a [[red halo]].

title: shiranui_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Japanese destroyer [i]Shiranui[/i]. Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Fujita Saki]].

She has [[pink hair]] and [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[aqua eyes]]. Her default outfit is the Konishi-design [i]Kagerou[/i]-class uniform ([[white shirt]], [[black vest]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[white gloves]]), with [[bike shorts]] like her sister Kagerou, [[white socks|white kneehighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]]. 

She is rather demure and cold. Almost none of her lines have a noticeable tone other than a calm disregard. While she never does anything cruel to her allies and will not reject the player's advances in game, she is indifferent with everything from socializing to marriage.

title: sleeveless_dress
body:
A [[dress]] with [[sleeveless|no (attached) sleeves]].

Sleeveless dress can be used together with [[detached sleeves]], since sleeveless dress only refers to the torso garment, and do not take detached sleeves into account.

Do not confuse this tag as a "catch-all" tag for all dresses that simply leave the shoulders [[bare shoulders|bare]].
* If the dress has a [i]low and wide-cut neckline[/i] and has [i]attached[/i] sleeves that sit on the arms instead of on the shoulders, it is an [[off-shoulder dress]].
* If the dress has no attached sleeves and has no support of the shoulders (ie. [[halterneck]]s, shoulder straps, etc.) to keep it in place, it is a [[strapless dress]].

Sleeveless dresses, [[strapless dress]]es, and [[off-shoulder dress]]es are mutually exclusive to each other.

h4. Correct examples
* !post #2221907
* !post #7303941
* !post #3267928

h4. Incorrect examples
Do not tag [[strapless dress]]es as "sleeveless dress".
* !post #8922940
* !post #6409043
* !post #8153590

h4. See also

* [[Spaghetti strap]]
* [[Strapless dress]]

title: forced_perspective
body:
An [[optical illusion]] where an object appears either closer, larger, smaller, or farther away than it actually is.

It manipulates human visual perception through the use of scaled objects and the correlation between them and the vantage point of the spectator or camera.

h4. Examples

* !post #8282783: Classic example of holding up the [[Leaning Tower of Pisa]]
* !post #590904: Grabbing the Sun

title: fortnite
body:
A free-to-play third-person shooter developed by Epic Games, notable for spearheading the surge in popularity for battle royale games and featuring collaboration events with other entertainment franchises and real-world music artists. Some of the copyrights that have collaborated with the game include [[Boku no hero academia]], [[Cowboy Bebop]], [[DC Comics]], [[Dragon Ball Super]], [[El Chapulin Colorado (Series)|]], [[Family Guy]], [[Futurama]], [[Jujutsu Kaisen]], [[Invincible (series)|Invincible]], [[Marvel]], [[Star Wars]], [[Naruto Shippuuden]] and [[Rick and Morty]].
 It is currently available for [[PlayStation 4]], [[PlayStation 5]], [[Xbox One]], [[Xbox Series X]], [[Nintendo Switch]], [[computer|PC]], and [[smartphone]]s.

The game has become the subject of many [[meme]]s due to its silly dance emotes, primarily minor playerbase, and the absurdity of its collab events.

title: hololive_idol_uniform_(origin)
body:
The [[official alternate costume|official]] [[idol clothes]] worn by [[hololive]] members for live events and in certain [[promotional art|promotional artworks]] between 2020 and 2023, originally co-designed by [[Amagai Tarou]] and [[Narumi Nanami]]. The uniform first debuted at the 2020 [[Nonstop Story]] live concert, and has since become the standard outfit for the group's idol activities.

Since new members usually don't receive their idol outfit until several months after debut, artists usually come up with their own interpretations that incorporate elements from their default outfits and may differ from the final official depiction.

h4. Original JP version

It consists of a [[sleeveless]] shirt, a [[layered skirt|layered]] [[white skirt]] [[miniskirt]] in a [[skirt set]], a golden [[belt]] with a small [[white bow|white]] [[bow skirt|bow]] on the hip and a [[large bow]] on the [[back bow|back]], [[white gloves]], [[wrist cuffs]] and [[white boots]]. The only exception to this is AZKi's version of the outfit, which is primarily black instead. The accent colors, legwear, and accessories differ to match each talent's color scheme and personality. The top of the outfit comes in 3 variants:
* The first variation, worn by [[Tokino Sora]], [[AZKi (hololive)|]], [[Hoshimachi Suisei]], [[Shirakami Fubuki]], [[Minato Aqua]], [[Nekomata Okayu]], [[Uruha Rushia]], [[Shiranui Flare]], [[Amane Kanata]], [[Omaru Polka]], [[Momosuzu Nene]] and [[Takane lui]] features a [[white vest]] with a [[bowtie]].
* The second variation, worn by [[Roboco-san]], [[Yozora Mel]], [[Aki Rosenthal]], [[Natsuiro Matsuri]], [[Nakiri Ayame]], [[Yuzuki Choco]], [[Oozora Subaru]], [[Shirogane Noel]], [[Houshou Marine]], [[Kiryu Coco]], [[Tsunomaki Watame]], & [[Shishiro Botan]] features a [[halter shirt]] with a [[navel]] [[navel cutout|cutout]] and an [[armlet]].
* The third variation, worn by [[Sakura Miko]], [[Akai Haato]], [[Murasaki Shion]], [[Ookami Mio]], [[Inugami Korone]], [[Usada Pekora]], [[Tokoyami Towa]], [[Himemori Luna]], & [[Yukihana Lamy]] features a [[corset]] or [[bodice]] with [[frills|frilled]] [[frilled straps|straps]].

h4. 2022 holoFes version

A different "version" of the outfit worn by all members was debuted at the 2022 hololive Super Expo, in which the members wear the official event [[t-shirt]] [[tied shirt|tied]] on top, while retaining their respective skirts and legwear from the regular idol outfit.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3731704: Original version
* !post #5231110: 2022 holoFes version

h4. See also

* [[hololive Idol Uniform (Bright)]] - The idol uniform introduced for the 4th Hololive Festival "Our Bright Future"
* [[hololive Idol Uniform (Color Rise)]] - The idol uniform introduced for the 6th Hololive Festival "Color Rise Harmony"
* [[holoMyth Anniversary outfit]] - The idol uniform worn by [[holoMyth]] during their 2nd anniversary
* [[List of hololive official costumes]]

title: crimvael
body:
Character from [[Ishuzoku Reviewers]].

An [[angel]] who's been visiting the mortal world and got into trouble. During that time, their halo broke and prevented them from returning to Heaven and using their angelic powers.

[b]Appearance:[/b] Petite body of androgynous shape, with the appearance of a mid-puberty teen, yet with both sets of "bulges" (chest and crotch). Waist-long [[blonde hair]] with shoulder-long [[sidelocks]]. [[Blue eyes]]. Wears a [[white_dress|white]] [[strapless dress]] that barely covers their [[bike shorts]], and wears [[brown sandals]] on their feet. Has simplistic [[angel_wings|angelic wings]] with a minimum of detail, and a [[halo]] in the shape of a broken torus.

h4. See also
* [[Clitorim]]

title: yuzuki_yukari
body:
Yuzuki Yukari is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] and [[VOICEROID]] developed by Vocalomakets and distributed by AH-Software Co. Ltd., and was released for the VOCALOID3 and VOICEROID+ engine on December 22, 2011. She is voiced by [[Ishiguro Chihiro]].

She has light [[purple hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. She wears a [[rabbit ears|rabbit eared]] [[hoodie]], [[halter dress]] (with a [[criss-cross halter]]), and [[striped legwear]]. She has [[hair ornament]]s, a single [[bracelet]], and shoes with an [[anklet]] design. Her hairstyle is [[short hair with long locks]] but it often looks like [[low twintails]].

In July 2020, it was announced that Yukari's next voicebank would be on the [[CeVIO]] engine. In 2021, voicebanks with the [[A.I. VOICE]] engine were also announced.

Her appearance is officially illustrated by [[Ayakura Juu]].

title: dragon_king_naga
body:
Dragon King Naga, the female king of the Dragon kingdom, is one of the protagonists of [[senki_survival_saga_-_isekai_no_unmei_wo_kaketa_mujintou_fujun_iseikouyuu|Senki Survival Saga - Isekai no Unmei o Kaketa Mujintou Fujun Iseikouyuu]].

Dragon King Naga possesses shapeshifting magic, able to switch between human and dragon form. In her human form, Naga is a [[dark-skinned_female|dark skinned]] woman with [[dragon_horns|dragon horns]], [[sharp_teeth|sharp teeth]], [[large_breasts|large breasts]], [[scales]] on her arms and legs.

title: anastasia_empirial
body:
Anastasia Empirial, the princess of the Elf kingdom, is one of the protagonists of [[senki_survival_saga_-_isekai_no_unmei_wo_kaketa_mujintou_fujun_iseikouyuu|Senki Survival Saga - Isekai no Unmei o Kaketa Mujintou Fujun Iseikouyuu]].

Anastasia is a [[petite]], [[blonde_hair|blonde haired]] [[elf]]. She wears a [[dress]] with [[detached_sleeves|detached sleeves]].

title: olga_of_kyiv
body:
[b]Olga of Kyiv[/b] was the ruler of the [[Ukraine|Rus']] from 945 to 960 (regent for her son Sviatoslav) and was later named a saint by the Eastern Orthodox Church for her efforts to convert the Rus' to Christianity.

Another deed she is famous for is her revenge on the Drevlians, who had her husband, Igor of Kyiv, killed.

h4. External links

* Wikipedia: "Olga of Kiev":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olga_of_Kiev]

Zero takes on the look of a female humanoid with very little biological features, she has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-toned]] [[black hair|black]] and [[white hair]], left side black and right side white, in a [[two side up]] style. title: tifa_(pgr)
body:
Tifa was a Construct in service to Babylonia's Task Force Suzaku, her team was defeated and her Commandant was killed prior to the story. <spoilers>She was captured and rebuilt by the Ascendant [[Roland (pgr)|]], turned into the enemy boss unit '[[Iron Maiden (pgr)|]]'</spoilers>. Her memory was recovered and recorded, designed to be used exclusively for Vera's [[vera: garnet (pgr)|Garnet]] frame.

A support type Construct, she uses two [[floating weapon|floating]] [[energy gun]]s in combat, her uniform consist of a [[grey dress|grey]] [[collared dress]], [[grey capelet|grey]] and [[red capelet]], [[black gloves]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[thigh boots]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] and [[red eyes]], her [[headgear]] has the appearance of a [[spiked headband]].

title: rosetta_(pgr)
body:
An enemy boss and later on a playable character of [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], leader of the Forest Guards of the Arctic Route Union, a military <spoilers>penal</spoilers> unit made up of advanced quadrupedal Constructs. Voiced by Sawahiro Miyuki.

Rosetta's only playable appearance in-game is the [[rosetta: rigor (pgr)|Rigor]] frame, almost entirely [[mechabare|mechanical]] and [[cyborg]] in appearance. She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[white hair]] with [[center-flap bangs]] and two [[short twintails]] at the back, has [[yellow eyes]].

As a boss encounter, she is [[taur]]/[[centauroid]] in appearance (see post #6339663), with a large mechanical half body attached to the back of her hips, forming a horse-like body for the centaur appearance.

There exists an [[aged down]] version of Rosetta when she was still human. That depiction also has a similar hairstyle as the Construct appearance, but with [[two side up]] in the hair style instead of the twintails.

h4. Appearance

body:
A NPC from [[Punishing: Gray Raven]], Simon is a human Commandant of Babylonia graduated from the Academy at the same time as the [[commandant (pgr)|player character]]. After the event of Firn Night he was assigned to lead the team 'Dark Aries', consist of Captain [[Palma (pgr)|]], [[Lillian (pgr)|]] and [[Noan (pgr)|]].

Simon has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], has [[long bangs]] [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], he has [[yellow eyes]] and wears a pair of [[round eyewear|round]] [[glasses]], has a single [[mole under eye|mole under left eye]]. His uniform consist of a [[blue coat|blue]] and [[brown coat]] ([[open coat]]) over a [[blue shirt]]. He is sometimes depicted with [[nausea]] as he suffers from vehicle related motion sickness.

title: aa_shuukatsu_no_megami-sama
body:
English translation: [b]Ah! My Job-Hunting Goddess[/b]

Spin-off manga of [[aa_megami-sama|Aa! Megami-sama]] by Aoki Yuhei and drawn by [[Yoshizuki Kumichi]], with series creator [[Fujishima Kousuke]] serving as a creative consultant. Taking place after the end of the main series, the spinoff chronicles the efforts of [[Belldandy]] in finding a job to help support [[Morisato Keiichi|Keiichi]] during a recession. It premiered in the March 2019 issue of Kodansha Monthly Afternoon magazine and ended in January 2022 for a total of thirty-four chapters spread across five volumes.

title: playing_card
body:
A classical set of [[card]] consists 52 unique cards, categorized by suit and by rank. The four suits of the french deck are [[heart|hearts]] (♥), [[spade_(shape)|spades]] (♠), [[club_(shape)|clubs]] (♣), and [[diamond (shape)|diamonds]] (♦). The ranks include Ace, the numbers two through ten, and the face cards Jack, Queen, and King. A [[joker (playing card)|]] or two may or not be present. These cards are used for various games, such as solitaire, poker, blackjack, etc. Often with [[gambling]] involved.

If characters are [[playing games]] with these cards, remember to tag the card faces accordingly. However, if the cards are too difficult to discern (for example they're very far away, stacked atop each other, depicted as loose scribbles, or are a nonstandard playing card), you don't need to tag the faces of those cards.

Additionally, if the actual playing card were played rather than being a simple prop or motif (i.e simply being held by the character), the tag [[card game]] is also applicable.

h4. See also
* [[playing card print]]
* [[playing card theme]]
* [[List of playing card faces]]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Playing_card]

title: booth_babe
body:
A [b]trade show model[/b] (also known as a convention model, trade show [[hostess]], booth companion, or booth professional; a term that has been used only in Japan is companion lady but today more often used is event companion (イベントコンパニオン)) is an assistant that works with a company's sales representatives at a trade show exhibit, working on the floor space or a [[booth seating]], and representing a company to attendees. Such models are used to draw in attendees and can provide them with basic information about product or services, and may be used to distribute marketing materials or gather customer information for future promotions. Attire varies and depends on the nature of the show and on the image the company would like to portray, and they sometimes wear wardrobe that is particular to the company, product, or service represented.

Trade show models are typically not regular employees of the company, but are hired as they make a company's booth more visibly distinguishable from other booths with which it competes for attendee attention. If needed, they can explain or disseminate information on the company and its product and service, and can assist a company in handling a large number of attendees which the company might otherwise not have enough employees to accommodate, therefore increasing the number of sales or leads resulting from participation in the show. The models can be skilled at drawing attendees into the booth, engaging them in conversation, and at spurring interest in the product, service, or company.

h4. See also
* [[race queen]]
* [[mascot]]
* [[revealing clothes]]
* [[company name]]
* [[clothes writing]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Promotional_model#Trade_show_model]
other_names: イベントコンパニオン

title: ark_royal_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the carrier HMS [i]Ark Royal[/i] (91). Character design by [[Konishi (koconatu)|]], voiced by [[Uchida Shuu]].

She is portrayed with [[short_hair|short]] [[red hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[blunt bangs]] and a [[tiara]]-like [[hairband]], [[blue eyes]], and [[small breasts]]. Her default (and only) outfit consists of a [[white shrug]], [[white corset]] that forms an [[overskirt]], [[black belt]], [[white shorts]], [[brown gloves|brown]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[white pantyhose]], and [[rudder footwear]].

Her [[rigging]] consists of her real-life hull as an overskirt, her carrier island and 113 mm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]]s on the back, her real-life funnel as a [[quiver]] to her right side, and her real-life [[flight deck]] as a bow. 

Similar to [[warspite (kancolle)|Warspite]], she has a prim and proper bearing, and mixes significant amounts of (generally well-spoken) English into her Japanese, although compared to Warspite, she has a more diligent personality, compared to Warspite's "regal bearing".

title: pagani
body:
Italian exclusive [[sports car|supercar]] manufacturer founded by Horacio Pagani, stationed in Modena, Emilia-Romagna. Notable for their eclectic design language and use of [i]carbotanium[/i], a compound of carbon fiber and titanium, which provides lightweight yet sturdy bodywork.

Pagani quickly acquired a positive reputation after launching their first model, the original [[Pagani Zonda|Zonda]], in 1999. The model went through several iterations and was joined by its successor, [[Pagani Huayra|Huayra]], in 2011. After several iterations of Huayra, Pagani announced its third-ever model, [[Pagani Utopia|Utopia]], in 2022 and produced its first examples in 2023.

Nowadays, Pagani enjoys a legendary status among the highest echelons of automotive.

title: godzilla_(shin)
body:
Also known as "Shin Godzilla". Lit. "True Godzilla".

The titular kaiju from [[Shin Godzilla]] who is a complete reimagination of the monster itself. Referred simply within the movie as "Godzilla".

This incarnation of Godzilla was born as a result of radiation from a classified nuclear waste dump site off the coast of Japan. As a result, the monster suffered from continuous and spontanous mutations akin to that of cancer cells, resulted in a constant pain. The monster [[Shin Godzilla's First Form|mutated]] [[Monster in Kamata|three]] [[Monster in Shinagawa|times]] before ending up in this form.

title: monster_in_kamata
body:
A [[spoilers|spoiler]] [[monster]]/[[kaiju]] in [[Shin Godzilla]], which made landfall in "Kamata, Ōta, Tokyo":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamata,_Tokyo], given the fan name "Kamata-Kun".

It has amphibian characteristics and a "frilled shark":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frilled_shark]-like head. Red fluid is periodically oozing from its [[gills]].

[spoiler]Actually it was the second form of "Larva/Proto-[[Godzilla]]" in the story. It metamorphosed into [[Monster in Shinagawa]] near the Kita-Shinagawa Station.[/spoiler]

h4.See also

* [[Shin Godzilla's First Form]]
* [[Monster in Shinagawa]]
* [[Godzilla (shin)|]] (the fourth form) 
* [[Godzilla's Tail Crawling with Creatures]]

h4. External links

* "Know Your Meme: Kamata-kun":[http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/kamata-kun]

title: duo_(duolingo)
body:
[[Duolingo]]'s green owl mascot, infamous for its usage in memes, where the mascot goes far beyond just pestering a user through smartphone notifications to ensure they don't slack off in their language studies in the app.

On February 11, 2025 the company announced the mascot's death.  On February 26, 2025 they announced their mascot was alive and that he had faked his own death.

title: koopa_troopa
body:
[[Turtle]]-like enemies from the [[Mario (series)|]] series, with shells that come in many different colors. Flying variants are usually called [[Koopa Paratroopa]]s.

Koopas, along with [[Goomba]]s, are some of [[Mario]]'s most persistent foes. They're common enemies in the Mario series, usually displayed as foot soldiers of the Koopa Troop, under the direct leadership of [[Bowser]]. Since [[Super Mario 64]], however, many Koopas have appeared who do not work for Bowser (or any other villain), some of whom even act as allies to Mario during his adventures.

In Japan, the Troopas are referred to as "Nokonoko".

h4. Official art
* !post #8044258

h4. See also
* [[Dry Bones]]
* [[Troopea]]

title: freight_train
body:
A freight train, also called a goods train or cargo train, is a railway [[train]] that is used to carry cargo, as opposed to passengers. Freight trains are made up of one or more [[locomotive]]s which provide propulsion, along with one or more railroad cars (also known as wagons) which carry freight. A wide variety of cargos are carried on trains, but the low friction inherent to rail transport means that freight trains are especially suited to carrying bulk and heavy loads over longer distances. [[Military]] train carrying military equipment also counts as freight train.

H4. Examples 
* !asset #23073832: [[Class C62]]: An example of a [[Steam Locomotive|Steam]] [[Locomotive]] Pulling a [[Freight Train]]
* !post #8076597: [[class EF64]]: An example of an [[Electric Locomotive|Electric]] [[Locomotive]] Pulling a [[Freight Train]]

title: alice_(megami_tensei)
body:
[i]"A ghost who appears as a small blonde girl. She seems young, but her magic powers are formidable. She is either the ghost of an English girl who died a sad death, or an evil spirit from a fevered writer's mind."[/i]
    —Devil Survivor 2 Compendium 

A recurring demon in the [[Megami Tensei]] series, she is the spirit of a young girl. Her design and abilities are inspired by the titular character of  [[alice (alice in wonderland)|Alice in Wonderland,]] while her personality derives from a spirit of European folklore, who is said to "befriend" misbehaving children by killing them. In the series, she will often ask the player to be her friend by "dying for her."

Debuting in [[Shin Megami Tensei I]], she takes the role of an NPC character; a deceased child who was resurrected by [[Nebiros (megami tensei)|]] and [[Belial (megami tensei)|]], aka "Uncle Black" and "Uncle Red."

h4. See also

* [[Alice (Alice in Wonderland)]]

h4. External links

* "Megami Tensei Wiki: Alice":http://megamitensei.wikia.com/wiki/Alice
